description:
The underlying `urlparse` function changes from parsing the query string into the path with a '?' to just parsing it into the `query` attribute. We need to accomodate this.


Since this is a change in an underlying library, I don't see a good way *we* can write a test against our code for this.
title: parse_url_transport broken under 2.7.3

comments.content:
The underlying `urlparse` function changes from parsing the query string into the path with a '?' to just parsing it into the `query` attribute. We need to accomodate this.


Since this is a change in an underlying library, I don't see a good way *we* can write a test against our code for this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rconradharris

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/37523
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
